lines.text:
[makes gagging noises]
"Neat"? Anybody who says my show is "neat" has to go.

[after Madonna declines to talk to her doctor off-camera]
She doesn't want to live off-camera, much less talk. There's nothing to say off-camera. Why would you say something if it's off-camera? What point is there existing?
I hate people who hate women. Actually I hate people who hate!
We shouldn't have any more sex. You should build an altar for me in home and worship it daily, and you call me collect!
It's pretty racy. I don't know if you could take it two nights.
Oh, you had to get racy on me, huh?
Dad, I'm not getting racy. I've been racy.
Well, can't you tone it down a bit?
For you? No, because that would be compromising my artistic integrity.
Of course.
[pause]
Do you undress in this performance?
No! Of course I don't.
Thanks for having us. It was really generous.
Thanks for coming.
We thought it was "neat".
"Neat"?
Really neat.
No one's ever described it as that.
Have fun. We won't be making that other deal.
Not neat enough for you?

[after learning Toronto police will arrest her if she simulates masturbation on-stage]
Last time I was on tour, Sean was in jail. I guess it's my turn.

[voiceover, as Madonna visits her mother's grave]
What I remember most about her was that she was - she was very kind and very gentle and very feminine. I don't know, I guess she seemed like an angel to me, but I suppose everybody thinks their mother's an angel when they're five. I also know she was really religious, so I never really understood why she was taken away from us. It seemed so unfair. I never thought that she had done something wrong, so oftentimes I wondered what I had done wrong.
Madonna, truth or dare?
Truth.
Who has been the love of your life, in your whole life?
My whole life? Sean. Sean.
[Madonna shows a television remote control to director Alec Keshishian, who is off-camera]
[last lines]
I'm going to press this thing. I'm going to press power. When I press it, the camera's going to go off instantly.
[presses power]
Go away! Cut it! Cut it, Alec! Cut it, goddamn it!
Do we wanna be accepted by Hollywood?
No!
Do we care what people think about us?
No!
Do we want people to kiss our ass?
Yes!
Okay now, do we want an "R" rating or an "X" rating?
"X" for extra fun!

[praying with her dancers before a concert]
We're dedicating tonight's performance to Keith Haring, who doesn't have the luxury of being alive like we do.

[makeup artist is trying to apply makeup to Madonna's lips during a tirade]
Do something else! Do my eyebrows!
[Complaining after her microphones dysfunction on stage]
Somebody sent some big fat man up in the front to give me dirty looks all night.
So what is considered masturbation?
When you stick your hand in your crotch.
We're here! We're queer! Get used to it!
I wouldn't live in Chicago cause it's too conservative, aside for the fact that Oprah Winfrey lives there.
I know I'm not the best singer and I know I'm not the best dancer, but I'm not interested in that. I'm interested in pushing people's buttons, in being provocative and in being political.

[about her fans]
Even when I feel like shit, they still love me!
I got the moves baby. You got the LOTION.
